t: The Lord Is My Light and My Salvation
The*pn Lord*s is my light and my salvation; whom*ld shall I fear? The*ln Lord*s is the stronghold of my life; of*ld whom shall I be afraid?
When*pn evildoers assail me to*ld eat up my flesh, my*ln adversaries and foes, it*ld is they who stumble and fall.
Though*pn an army encamp against me, my*ld heart shall not fear; though*ln war arise against me, yet*ld I will be confident.

One*pn thing have I asked of the Lord,*s that*ld will I seek after: that*ln I may dwell in the house of the Lord*s all*ld the days of my life, to*ln gaze upon the beauty of the Lord*s and*ld to inquire in his temple.
For*pn he will hide me in his shelter in*ld the day of trouble; he*ln will conceal me under the cover of his tent; he*ld will lift me high upon a rock.
And*pn now my head shall be lifted up above*ld my enemies all around me, and*ln I will offer in his tent sacrifices*ld with shouts of joy; I*ln will sing and make melody to the Lord.*s
Hear,*pn O Lord,*s when I cry aloud; be*ld gracious to me and answer me!
You*ln have said, “Seek my face.” My*ln heart says to you, “Your*ld face, Lord,*s do I seek.”
Hide*ld not your face from me. Turn*ln not your servant away in anger, O*ld you who have been my help. Cast*ln me not off; forsake me not, O*ld God of my salvation!
For*ln my father and my mother have forsaken me, but*ld the Lord*s will take me in.
Teach*pn me your way, O Lord,*s and*ld lead me on a level path because*ld of my enemies.
Give*ln me not up to the will of my adversaries; for*ld false witnesses have risen against me, and*ld they breathe out violence.
I*pn believe that I shall look upon the goodness of the Lord*s in*ld the land of the living!
Wait*ln for the Lord;*s be*ld strong, and let your heart take courage; wait*ld for the Lord!*s
